folder: Greenwich Street & Cortlandt Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Greenwich Street, south from Cortlandt Street, as photo- graphed from the Ninth Avenue "El" station, showing mainly the trackage below this point.

About 1900's

Thomas W. Kennedy, photo
Thru Beecher Ogden
Museum Photographers Assn.

folder: Greenwich Street & Cortlandt Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
165 Greenwich Street, east side, south of Cortlandt Street, showing the upper floors of a 5-story loft building. Obscuring the street level is the 9th Avenue "El" line.

August 19, 1914

Wurts Brothers

folder: Cortlandt Street & Greenwich Street & [Radio Row.], Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
cortlandt Street, north side, from West to Greenwich Streets.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing the south side of the street and the Cortlandt Elevated Station at Greenwich Street.
May 8, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, showing less of the south side of the street. All the pictures in the group also show a view of West Street, at, adjoining, and north of the N.W. corner of Cortlandt Street.
May 8, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Cortlandt Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
60-84 Cortlandt Street, from, but not including Greenwich Street, to north of Washington Street. June 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, slightly more inclusive; to and including West Street.
May 11, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Cortlandt Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Cortlandt Street, south side, from but not including Greenwich to West Streets.

June 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Greenwich Street & Cortlandt Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Greenwich Street, north from Cortlandt Street, showing surface conditions under the Ninth Avenue Elevated. Note that the street car tracks are being removed. The intersection in the midground is Dey Street.

June 2, 1937

W. P. A. photo
Five Boroughs Project

folder: Greenwich Street & Cortlandt Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Greenwich Street, north from Cortlandt Street, as photographed from the downtown "El" platform showing details of the station here prior to demolition. In the center is an express platform and across same is an enclosed passageway connecting the various units. The white building in the background is the new U. S. Federal Office Building and Post Office.

June 7, 1940
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

folder: Greenwich Street & Cortlandt Street, Manhattan, NY

Federal Office Building and Post Office.

June 7, 1940
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

folder: Cortlandt Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
1-Cortlandt Street, southeast corner from northwest side of Greenwich Street looking southwards. Elevated station formerly at this corner.

2-Greenwich Street, east side, at the southeast corner of Cortlandt Street.

3-Greenwich Street, northeast corner and Cortlandt Streets, looking northwards.

P. L. Sperr
May 4, 1941
